This document, RAP Publication 2006/06, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 2 of 7 of volume 3, contains the first part of the study of Thailand. Volume 1 synthesises the findings of the case studies and volume 2 presents the case studies for China and India. Other sections and volumes of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

description: These case studies of economic growth in the Republic of Korea, Thailand and Vietnam were compiled as part of a study examining the economic growth of five Asian countries and the implications of that growth for agriculture and food security. Volume 1 synthesises the findings of the case studies and volume 2 presents the case studies for China and India. Other sections and volumes of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

description: These case studies of economic growth in the Republic of Korea, Thailand and Vietnam were compiled as part of a study examining the economic growth of five Asian countries and the implications of that growth for agriculture and food security. Other sections and volumes of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Rapid growth of selected Asian economies. Lessons and implications for agriculture and food security: Republic of Korea, Thailand and Viet Nam: part 7
description: These case studies of economic growth in the Republic of Korea, Thailand and Vietnam were compiled as part of a study examining the economic growth of five Asian countries and the implications of that growth for agriculture and food security. This document, RAP Publication 2006/06, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 7 of 7 of volume 3, contains part 3 of the study of Vietnam. Volume 1 synthesises the findings of the case studies and volume 2 presents the case studies for China and India. Other sections and volumes of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Rapid growth of selected Asian economies. Lessons and implications for agriculture and food security: synthesis report
description: This document draws together the results of case studies examining the economic growth of five Asian countries and the implications of that growth for agriculture and food security. The countries covered are: China, India, the Republic of Korea, Thailand and Vietnam. It seeks to derive lessons which can be applied to assist other countries in their agricultural and rural development and in poverty reduction and hunger eradication. The document, volume 1 of the study and RAP Publication 2006/04, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. The case studies are published in volumes 2 and 3.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Reducing investment climate constraints to higher growth: Lao People's Democratic Republic private sector and investment climate assessment
description: This report presents the results of a survey of the private sector investment climate in Laos. The survey collected data from 303 firms in six sectors and seven provinces covering manufacturing, the service industry and the informal economy. It examined infrastructure, finance, labour, regulatory burden and administrative delays, governance, innovation and technology, and productivity. This document, no.41845, was published by The World Bank in 2007.
author: World Bank; Asian Development Bank

title: Report of the national workshop on micro-enterprise development in coastal communities in the Philippines: sharing of experiences and lessons learned
description: This workshop, held in Davao City, Philippines, 710 March 2006, aimed to identify good practice in microenterprise development in coastal communities in the Philippines. This document, FAO Fisheries Report No. 850, provides a summary of the findings of the workshop together with workshop papers and case studies. It was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2007.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Results of the Rural Investment Climate Assessment (RICA) in Indonesia: final report
description: This report presents the results of a 2006 survey of more than 2,500 predominantly very small firms in six rural districts in Indonesia. The survey examined the labour force, credit, infrastructure, marketing and competition, diffusion of technical knowledge, local governance and the main obstacles faced by the firms. This document, Report no. 44033 -10, was published by The World Bank in June 2008.

title: Review of stock enhancement practices in the inland water fisheries of Asia
description: This report examines inland fishery practices in Asian countries looking at fisheries in which some form of stock enhancement is practised. The countries include: Bangladesh, Myanmar, India, Indonesia, China, Thailand and Vietnam. The report covers: inland water resources in Asia; inland fisheries in selected countries in the region; general stock enhancement; stock enhancement of floodplain fisheries; stock enhancement in large lakes and reservoirs; recommendations for stock enhancement in large lacustrine waterbodies; stock enhancement in small and medium-sized inland waterbodies; biodiversity issues relating to stock enhancement; and socio-economic issues relating to stock enhancement. This document, RAP Publication 2005/12, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2005.
author: Sena S De Silva; Simon Funge-Smith
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Scaling-up microfinance for India's rural poor
description: This paper examines the current level and pattern of access to finance for India's rural households, particularly the poor, and considers some key microfinance activity in India, focusing on the Self Help Group (SHG) Bank Linkage initiative. The paper is World Bank Policy Research Working Paper 3646, and was published in June 2005.
author: Priya Basu; Pradeep Srivastava

title: Seasonal hunger and public policies: evidence from northwest Bangladesh
description: This book presents a detailed analysis of seasonal hunger in Bangladesh arising from agricultural seasonality, the challenges it presents and policies to address this issue. It starts with global concepts and issues, looks at the situation across Bangladesh and then focuses on the northwest region of the country. The effectiveness of various programmes is examined and the potential of microfinance to address seasonality is discussed. This document, one of a series of Directions in Development: Poverty, and document no.70268, was published by The World Bank in 2012.
author: Shahidur R Khandker; Wahiduddin Mahmud

title: Strengthening China's technological capacity
description: This paper considers how China can accelerate their technology development and the most cost-effective measures to achieve this. It examines China's current manufacturing capabilities and lessons that can be learned from other leading exporting countries and late-starting economies and discusses supporting universities and creating links with businesses, establishing channels for focusing research and diffusing research findings and creating urban centres that attract innovation activities.
author: Shahid Yusuf; Kaoru Nabeshima

title: Smallholder dairy development: Lessons learned in Asia: part 2
description: This report presents case studies of the dairy industry in nine Asian countries. It considers policies that have promoted the growth of the industry and models which have or have not contributed to this growth. The countries covered include: Bangladesh, China, India, the Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam. This document, RAP Publication 2009/02, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2009. This section, part 2 of 2, contains papers on Sri Lanka, the Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam, lessons learned and dairy policies and sector planning. Part 1 is also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Nancy Morgan (editor)
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Social protection for a changing India: volume I: executive summary
description: This is the executive summary of a report which examines the current state of social protection systems in India including key performance indicators (KPIs), programme finance and administration, and methods of targeting the systems to best benefit recipients. It considers: promotional measures to improve incomes, e.g. targeted credit and livelihood programmes; preventative measures to help households manage risk, e.g. public social insurance programmes; and, protective measures, e.g. social pensions and targeted housing programmes. This document, 61275 v1, was published by the World Bank in 2011. The full report is also included in the e-library.

title: Social protection for a changing India: volume II: main report
description: This report examines the current state of social protection systems in India including key performance indicators (KPIs), programme finance and administration, and methods of targeting the systems to best benefit recipients. It considers: promotional measures to improve incomes, e.g. targeted credit and livelihood programmes; preventative measures to help households manage risk, e.g. public social insurance programmes; and, protective measures, e.g. social pensions and targeted housing programmes. This document, the full version of the report, 61275 v2, was published by the World Bank in 2011. The executive summary is also included separately in the e-library.

title: Stocktaking of livelihood projects in India: a synthesis paper
description: This study examined project outcomes and impacts from a series of rural livelihood projects in seven States of India supported by The World Bank over the last ten years. It seeks to draw lessons to help in the design of future interventions. The paper synthesises six working papers prepared by FAO consultants. It was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2012.
author: Jim Hancock; Pari Bauman
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Sustainability of microfinance self help groups in India: would federating help?
description: This exploratory study examined the possibility of forming self-help group (SHG) federations in India in order to make the SHGs more organisationally and financially sustainable. It examined best practice from a sample of federations and identified both benefits and constraints associated with federating. This document, Policy Research Working Paper 3516, was published by The World Bank in February 2005.
author: Ajai Nair

title: Sustaining urban growth through innovative capacity: Beijing and Shanghai in comparison
description: This study examines the development of innovative industries in the cities of Beijing and Shanghai, and considers the role of urban policy in the growth of innovative industrial clusters. This document, Policy Research Working Paper 3545, was published by The World Bank in March 2005.
author: Wang Jici; Tong Xin

title: Thailand and FAO: achievements and success stories
description: This report summarises projects that the Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations (FAO) has funded in Thailand over the past 30 years. These include: industrial crop development; food safety and quality control; and, poverty reduction and promotion of household food security. The report was published by the Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2011.
publisher: Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Towards an Indian common market: removal of restrictions on internal trade in agricultural commodities
description: This study examined the current state of Indian agriculture and trade in agricultural products, and the actions required to remove unnecessary restrictions on the movement of agriculture products both within and between States in India. The study drew upon lessons learned from European Union market integration and had as an ultimate aim the enhancement of international trade in primary products in India. This document was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2005.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Complex analysis, Chapter 8: Series
description: This book contains chapters on complex numbers, complex functions, elementary functions, integration, Cauchy's Theorem, harmonic functions, series, Taylor and Laurent series, poles, residues and argument principle.
author: George Cain

title: Trade reforms and food security. Country case studies and synthesis: part I
description: This report presents case studies of 15 countries aimed at examining trade-related reforms and food security. The countries are from different regions of the world and are at different stages of development, focusing on low-income countries that are likely to be at greater risk of food insecurity. They include China and India. This document was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 1 of 4, contains the contents list, preface, a synthesis of the findings, a paper on Cameroon and the first part of a paper on Chile. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Harmon Thomas; Jamie Morrison
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Trade reforms and food security. Country case studies and synthesis: part II
description: This report presents case studies of 15 countries aimed at examining trade-related reforms and food security. The countries are from different regions of the world and are at different stages of development, focusing on low-income countries that are likely to be at greater risk of food insecurity. They include China and India. This document was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 2 of 4, contains the second part of a paper on Chile, country case studies for China, Ghana and Guatemala, and the first part of a paper on Guyana. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Harmon Thomas; Jamie Morrison
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Trade reforms and food security. Country case studies and synthesis: part III
description: This report presents case studies of 15 countries aimed at examining trade-related reforms and food security. The countries are from different regions of the world and are at different stages of development, focusing on low-income countries that are likely to be at greater risk of food insecurity. They include China and India. This document was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 3 of 4, contains the second part of a paper on Guyana, case studies for India, Kenya and Malawi, and the first part of a paper on Morocco. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Harmon Thomas; Jamie Morrison
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Trade reforms and food security. Country case studies and synthesis: part IV
description: This report presents case studies of 15 countries aimed at examining trade-related reforms and food security. The countries are from different regions of the world and are at different stages of development, focusing on low-income countries that are likely to be at greater risk of food insecurity. They include China and India. This document was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 4 of 4, contains the second part of a paper on Morocco, and case studies for Nigeria, Peru, Senegal, the United Republic of Tanzania and Uganda. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Harmon Thomas; Jamie Morrison
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Who migrates overseas and is it worth their while? An assessment of household survey data from Bangladesh
description: This paper uses household survey data from Bangladesh to examine international migration and the benefits for families remaining in the country. It covers: the characteristics of households who choose to migrate; migration-related costs and remittance transfer channels; and, the impact of migration on household welfare. This document, Policy Research Working Paper 5018, was published by The World Bank in August 2009.
author: Manohar Sharma; Hassan Zaman

title: Working with local institutions to support sustainable livelihoods
description: This paper examines issues related to undertaking development activities in conjunction with local institutions in order to achieve sustainable local development in rural areas. It includes case studies from India, Mozambique and Mexico together with detailed profiles of a number of local institutions including dairy cooperatives in India, panchayats in India, participatory watershed development in India and traditional institutions in the Philippines. The paper was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2003.
author: Robin Marsh
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Housing reconstruction in urban and rural areas
description: This note discusses urban and rural housing reconstruction following natural disasters and draws lessons from India, Pakistan and Turkey. The note is Working Paper Series No. 9, one of a series of EAP DRM KnowledgeNotes on disaster risk management in East Asia and the Pacific. It was published by The World Bank in 2010. This note was prepared for the Government of China as part of a series of good practice notes on post-disaster recovery following the Wenchuan Earthquake that struck on 12 May 2008.
author: Zoe Trohanis; Geoffrey Read

title: Brackets: Mathematics support materials
description: This resource on brackets includes quizzes, exercises and worked examples covering the distributive rule and the use of the mnemonic FOIL when expanding brackets. It is one of a collection of mathematics support materials in basic algebra provided for schools and colleges by the University of Plymouth School of Mathematics and Statistics.
author: Robin Horan; Martin Lavelle
publisher: School of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Plymouth

title: Complex analysis, Chapter 9: Taylor and Laurent series
description: This book contains chapters on complex numbers, complex functions, elementary functions, integration, Cauchy's Theorem, harmonic functions, series, Taylor and Laurent series, poles, residues and argument principle.
author: George Cain

title: Trends in poverty and livelihoods in coastal fishing communities of Orissa State, India
description: The Sustainable Livelihoods Approach (SLA) is used to analyse the livelihoods of marine fishing communities in the Indian coastal state of Orissa. Relationships between livelihoods and coastal poverty are investigated and simple qualitative indicators developed to monitor the changes in these relationships over time. The report also includes an overview of the marine fisheries sector and an outline of the main livelihood groups. This document, FAO Fisheries Technical Paper. No. 490, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006.
author: Venkatesh Salagrama
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: AP®︎ Statistics
description: Learn a powerful collection of methods for working with data! AP®️ Statistics is all about collecting, displaying, summarizing, interpreting, and making inferences from data.

title: Two dragon heads: contrasting development paths for Beijing and Shanghai
description: This book compares and contrasts the development paths followed by two of China's megacities, Beijing and Shanghai, and considers the policies and strategies that would be required to maintain their growth and development momentum. It covers: factors contributing to success; manufacturing industry; the pitfalls of early de-industrialisation; economic composition, resources and the emerging innovation potentials; and making industries innovative. The book, publication no.52706, was published by The World Bank in 2010.
author: Shahid Yusuf; Kaoru Nabeshima

title: Use of the formal and informal financial sectors: does gender matter? Empirical evidence from rural Bangladesh
description: This study examines formal and informal financial sectors in rural Bangladesh and considers the relationship between gender and access to finance. It uses data from a national survey which included questions on money borrowed, lent and transferred. This document, Policy Research Working Paper 3491, was published by The World Bank in January 2005.
author: Signe-Mary McKernan; Mark M Pitt; David Moskowitz

title: Welfare and poverty impacts of India's National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme: evidence from Andhra Pradesh
description: This paper explores the short and medium-term poverty and welfare effects of the National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme in Andhra Pradesh. The public work program guarantees up to 100 days works per year, serving as a substitute for insurance. This paper discusses the affect that this program has had on gender equality, poverty reduction, welfare and the local economy. This report was published by The World Bank in 2013.
author: Klaus Deininger; Yanyan Liu

title: What does debt relief do for development? Evidence from India's bailout program for highly-indebted rural households
description: This study examined the impact of a large-scale debt relief programme on subsequent activities and economic decisions of affected households. It used as a basis India's Debt Relief Program for Small and Marginal Farmers which waived agricultural debt issued by commercial and cooperative banks between 1997 and 2007, with eligibility determined according to the amount of land pledged as collateral for the loans. This document, Policy Research Working Paper 6258 and Impact Evaluation Series No. 75, was published by The World Bank in november 2012.
author: Martin Kanz

title: What explains big gender disparities in India? local industrial structures and female entrepreneurship
description: This report analyzes the spatial factors that promote female entrepreneurship and business ownership in the unorganized manufacturing and services sectors in India to determine the causes of gender disparities in women's economic participation. It examines female entrepreneurship rates, spatial determinants of female entrepreneurship including district-level conditions and agglomeration theories and analysis of relative female entrepreneurship rates. This report was published by The World Bank in 2012.
author: Ejaz Ghani; William R. Kerr; Stephen D. O'Connell

title: What makes cities more competitive? Spatial determinants of entrepreneurship in India
description: This study studied the spatial location of entrepreneurs (firms less than three years old) in India in both the manufacturing and services sectors. Data was examined for 630 districts spread across 35 states/union territories and factors influencing entrepreneurship were identified. This document, Policy Research Working Paper 6198, was published by The World Bank in September 2012.
author: Ejaz Ghani; William R Kerr; Stephen D OConnell

title: Who you train matters: identifying complementary effects of financial education on migrant households
description: The impact of financial literacy programmes on financial management and hence savings was examined for households in Indonesia which received remittances from migrant workers. The study examined the variation in results obtained when household members, migrant workers or both were trained. This document, Policy Research Working Paper 6157 and Impact Evaluation Series No. 65, was published by The World Bank in August 2012.
author: Yoko Doi; David McKenzie; Bilal Zia

title: Thoughts on the right transfer issues of farming land
description: This article examines issues relating to farming rights transfer in China and presents some suggestions as to how farming rights transfer might be managed. The article was published in the Journal of Geography and Geology Vol. 1, No. 1; May 2009.
author: Furong Song; Lifeng Dong
publisher: Canadian Center of Science and Education

title: Workshop on assessment and management of the offshore resources of South and Southeast Asia
description: This document provides a summary of the proceedings of a workshop on the current status of offshore resources in South and Southeast Asia and the potential for developing new fishing activities. The workshop was held in Bangkok, Thailand, 17-19 June 2008. The document includes country statements from Brunei Darussalam, India, Indonesia, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam together with a discussion of the opportunities, challenges and potential benefits. This document, RAP Publication 2009/13, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2009.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: About urban mega regions: knowns and unknowns
description: The potential development of mega urban economies in three South East Asian locations - Bangkok, Jakarta and the Singapore  Iskander Development Region (IDR) (South Johor) - is discussed. The gains from closer economic integration and the issues to be settled before this could occur are examined. Lessons are drawn from the fusing of the economies of Hong Kong and the Pearl River Delta in Chinas Guangdong Province. This document is Policy Research Working Paper 4252 from the World Bank Development Research Group, and was published in June 2007.
author: Shahid Yusuf

title: About urban mega regions: knowns and unknowns
description: The potential development of mega urban economies in three South East Asian locations - Bangkok, Jakarta and the Singapore  Iskander Development Region (IDR) (South Johor) - is discussed. The gains from closer economic integration and the issues to be settled before this could occur are examined. Lessons are drawn from the fusing of the economies of Hong Kong and the Pearl River Delta in Chinas Guangdong Province. This document is Policy Research Working Paper 4252 from the World Bank Development Research Group, Published June 2007.
author: Shahid Yusuf

title: Analysis of land use and land cover changes, and their ecological implications in Wuhan, China
description: This article examines changes in land use in Wuhan, China, over the period 1987-2005. The study used remote sensing techniques to determine land use data and spatial analysis software to quantify ecological metrics at both landscape and class levels. The article was published in the Journal of Geography and Geology Vol. 3, No. 1; September 2011.
author: Victor Tamba Simbay Kabba; Jiangfeng Li
publisher: Canadian Center of Science and Education

title: Commonly used sets: Mathematics for computer science facts and formulae
description: This sheet describes commonly used sets, together with set algebra and logic definitions and examples. The resource forms 1 of 11 mathematics for computer science fact sheets produced by mathcentre.

title: Complex analysis, Contents
description: This book contains chapters on complex numbers, complex functions, elementary functions, integration, Cauchy's Theorem, harmonic functions, series, Taylor and Laurent series, poles, residues and argument principle.
author: George Cain

title: Asian fisheries today: the production and use of low value/trash fish from marine fisheries in the Asia-Pacific region
description: This report provides an overview of the production and use of low value/trash fish in the Asia-Pacific region. It defines low value/trash fish as fish that have a low commercial value by virtue of their low quality, small size or low consumer preference. It examines their use in aquaculture and other animal feeds, and in human consumption. Countries discussed are Bangladesh, India, Thailand, Vietnam, China and the Philippines. Some data are provided for other countries in the region. This document, RAP Publication 2005/16, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2005.
author: Simon Funge-Smith; Erik Lindebo; Derek Staples
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Changing the industrial geography in Asia: the impact of China and India
description: This report examines the consequences of recent globalization for Asia's industrial geography through analysis of industrial trends, patterns and national manufacturing capabilities in its two most populated and fastest-growing economies China and India to explore the future of industrial development and trade across the Asia region. It discusses the development experience of China and India, trade dynamics in China and India, unfolding industry dynamics in East and South Asia and the drivers of Asia's industrial geography. This report was published by The World Bank in 2010.
author: Shahid Yusuf; Kaoru Nabeshima

title: Determinants of remittances: recent evidence using data on internal migrants in Vietnam
description: This report examines the determinants of remittance behaviour for internal migrants in Vietnam by studying how remittances are affected by the vulnerability of a migrant's life at the destination, their link to relatives back home and the time spent at the destination. It includes a review of literature about the motives behind remittance behaviour and an empirical analysis based on data taken from the 2004 Vietnam Migration Survey. This report was published by The World Bank in 2008.
author: Yoko Niimi; Thai Hung Pham; Barry Reilly

title: Does the minimum wage affect employment? Evidence from the manufacturing sector in Indonesia
description: This paper uses firm-level survey data from the Indonesian manufacturing industry to investigate the impact of minimum wages on employment and wages offered by Indonesian manufacturing firms from 1993 to 2006. It examines the effects on workers by production and non-production type, education level, and gender. This document, Policy Research Working Paper 6147, was published by The World Bank in July 2012.
author: Ximena Del Carpio; Ha Nguyen; Liang Choon Wang

title: Fishing fleet in Aceh Province, Indonesia
description: This report provides an overview of the status of the fishing fleet in Aceh Province, Indonesia, at the end of 2006 to assist in the sustainable restoration of the small-scale fisheries sub-sector following the 2004 tsunami. it uses different sources of data, but focuses on a fishing vessel census. The report, RAP Publication 2009/09, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO).
author: David Lymer; Simon Funge-Smith; Dominique Greboval
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: From flying geese to leading dragons: new opportunities and strategies for structural transformation in developing countries
description: This policy research report highlights the potential for successful economic development of any country if it develops industries that are consistent with its comparative advantage (the flying geese pattern). Countries like China, India and Brazil are currently transforming from flying geese to leading dragons through their movement from low-skilled, labor-intensive manufacturing jobs, leaving these industries open to countries with lower income levels such as Africa. This report covers the mechanics and benefits of structural change, intellectual lessons from failures and successes of structural transformation and a unique window of opportunity for Africa: the graduation of China (and other middle-income countries). This report was published by The World Bank in 2011.
author: Justin Yifu Lin

title: Issues in the global tobacco economy: selected case studies
description: This document contains six tobacco industry country case studies examining issues such as production, demand, trade and economic significance. The countries covered include China and India. The case studies were prepared for a project examining the global tobacco economy. The document was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2003.
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Leading dragons phenomenon: new opportunities for catch-up in low-income countries
description: This policy research report discusses the potential opportunities arising for low-income countries from the Leading Dragon Phenomenon as China upgrades from the leading exporter of labor-intensive products to more capital- and technology-intensive industries. The discussion includes structural transformation and catch-up; industrialization, the Flying Geese Pattern and catching up in a historical perspective; and the emergence of Leading Dragons, the potential relocation of labor intensive industries from China and India. This report was published by The World Bank in 2012.
author: Vandana Chandra; Justin Yifu Lin; Yan Wang

title: Light manufacturing in Vietnam: creating jobs and prosperity in a middle-income economy
description: This report explores the five light manufacturing industries that are core to the industrial sector in Vietnam (apparel, leather, wood products, metal products and agribusiness). Chapters include industrial growth in the overall development context, industrial structure and sectoral issues, strengthening light manufacturing, a chapter on each core industry describing the sector and discussing its potential and constraints as well as a chapter on synthesis, reforms and policy implementation. This report was published by The World Bank in 2013.
author: Hinh T. Dinh

title: Malaysia-Indonesia remittance corridor: making formal transfers the best option for women and undocumented migrants
description: This report examines the increasing flow of migrants but decreasing amount of remittances through the Malaysian-Indonesian corridor in order to increase the impact that remittances have on economic growth and poverty reduction in Indonesia and to investigate options for attracting more migrants to use the formal financial sector. It covers migration and remittance trends in the global and regional context, migrants and remittances through the Malaysia-Indonesia corridor and the mechanism of formal and informal transaction flows. This report was published by The World Bank in 2008.
author: Raul Hernandez-Coss; Gillian Brown; Chitrawati Buchori; Isaku Endo; Emiko Todoroki; Tita Naovalitha; Wameek Noor; Cynthia Mar

title: Marine fisheries of Cambodia: part 1
description: This document describes a review of Cambodian marine fisheries based on work carried out in the country in early 2003. It describes the marine fishery sector; identifies opportunities, constraints, and paths to solutions for the sector; and identifies areas for follow-up investigation. This section, 1 of 3, contains the introduction to the report and the description of the marine fisheries sector. The document, FAO/FishCode Review No. 4, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2004. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Robert Gillett
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Complexity functions: Mathematics for computer science facts and formulae
description: An introduction to complexity functions and combinatorics, providing definitions and examples. The resource forms 1 of 11 mathematics for computer science fact sheets produced by mathcentre.

title: Introduction to real analysis
description: This book includes real numbers, differential calculus of functions of one variable, integral calculus of functions of one variable, infinite sequences and series, real-valued functions of several variables, vector-valued functions of several variables, integrals of functions of several variables and metric spaces. Two supplements to this book are available as separate documents.
author: William F. Trench

title: Elementary calculus: an infinitesimal approach, Contents
description: This book includes chapters on real and hyperreal numbers, differentiation, continuous functions, integration, limits, analytic geometry and approximations, applications of the integral, trigonometric functions, exponential and logarithmic functions, infinite series, vectors, partial differentiation, multiple integrals, vector calculus and differential equations.
author: H. Jerome Keisler

title: Multivariable calculus, Chapter 19: Some physics
description: This book on multivariable calculus contains chapters on euclidean three space, vectors, vector functions, derivatives, dimensions, linear functions and matrices, continuity and derivatives, the Taylor Polynomial, sequences and series, Taylor Series, integration, surfaces, Gauss' Theorem and Stokes' Theorem. This chapter is about physics.
author: George Cain; James Herod

title: Marine fisheries of Cambodia: part 2
description: This document describes a review of Cambodian marine fisheries based on work carried out in the country in early 2003. It describes the marine fishery sector; identifies opportunities, constraints, and paths to solutions for the sector; and identifies areas for follow-up investigation. This section, 2 of 3, covers marine fishery resources, threats to fishery resources, marine fishery production, fishing gear and the fishing fleet. The document, FAO/FishCode Review No. 4, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2004. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Robert Gillett
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Marine fisheries of Cambodia: part 3
description: This document describes a review of Cambodian marine fisheries based on work carried out in the country in early 2003. It describes the marine fishery sector; identifies opportunities, constraints, and paths to solutions for the sector; and identifies areas for follow-up investigation. This section, 3 of 3, covers processing and marketing of marine fishery products, stock assessment, fisheries legislation, fisheries management, fisheries institutions, limiting fishing effort, promoting community fisheries management, improving enforcement, improving availability of information, and suggestions for donor assistance. Previous reviews of Cambodia's marine fisheries are summarised. The document, FAO/FishCode Review No. 4, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2004. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Robert Gillett
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Miraculous Ningguo City of China and analysis of influencing factors of competitive advantage
description: Factors influencing the rapid economic development of Ningguo City, Anhui Province, China, were determined by comparing the economic competitiveness of 61 counties (cities) in that province in 2004. This article was published in the Journal of Geography and Geology Vol. 3, No. 1; September 2011.
author: Wei Shui
publisher: Canadian Center of Science and Education

title: Moving forward, looking back: the impact of migration and remittances on assets, consumption, and credit constraints in the rural Philippines
description: This paper presents the results of a survey of 448 families in rural Mindanao in the Philippines which examines the impact of migration and remittances and finds the largest impact is on the total value of non-land assets and on educational expenditures.
author: Agnes R. Quisumbing; Scott McNiven
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Providing social protection and livelihood support during post-earthquake recovery
description: This note discusses the use of cash transfer and public works programmes to support vulnerable households and to help rebuild local infrastructure and economies following a natural disaster such as an earthquake. It summarises lessons of relevance to China. The note is Working Paper Series No. 15, one of a series of EAP DRM KnowledgeNotes on disaster risk management in East Asia and the Pacific. It was published by The World Bank in 2010. This note was prepared for the Government of China as part of a series of good practice notes on post-disaster recovery following the Wenchuan Earthquake that struck on 12 May 2008.
author: Tara Vishwanath; Xiaoqing Yu

title: Review and synthesis of capture fisheries data in Thailand: large versus small-scale fisheries: part 1
description: This report examines the state of the fishing industry in Thailand. It covers large-scale and small-scale fisheries, marine and inland capture fisheries, and capture fisheries out of Thai waters by Thai fishing boats. This document, RAP Publication 2008/17, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2008. This section, part 1 of 2, contains the contents list, information on Thailand's capture fisheries and the first part of the section on inland fisheries. Part 2 is also catalogued in the e-library.
author: D Lymer; S Funge-Smith; P Khemakorn; S Naruepon; S Ubolratana
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Determinants 1: Mathematics support materials
description: This resource on the calculation and properties of two by two determinants includes quizzes, exercises and worked examples. It is one of a collection of mathematics support materials provided for schools and colleges by the University of Plymouth School of Mathematics and Statistics.
author: Robin Horan; Martin Lavelle
publisher: School of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Plymouth

title: Introduction to real analysis, Supplement I: Functions defined by improper integrals
description: This document supplements Section 3.4 Improper Integrals of the book Introduction to Real Analysis by Williams F. Trench.
author: William F. Trench

title: Laplacian: Mathematics support materials
description: This resource on the use of the Laplacian operator in vector calculus includes quizzes, exercises and worked examples. It is one of a collection of mathematics support materials provided for schools and colleges by the University of Plymouth School of Mathematics and Statistics.
author: Robin Horan; Martin Lavelle
publisher: School of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Plymouth

title: Multivariable calculus, Chapter 5: More dimensions
description: This book on multivariable calculus contains chapters on euclidean three space, vectors, vector functions, derivatives, dimensions, linear functions and matrices, continuity and derivatives, the Taylor Polynomial, sequences and series, Taylor Series, integration, surfaces, Gauss' Theorem and Stokes' Theorem. This chapter is about dimensions.
author: George Cain; James Herod

title: Review and synthesis of capture fisheries data in Thailand: large versus small-scale fisheries: part 2
description: This report examines the state of the fishing industry in Thailand. It covers large-scale and small-scale fisheries, marine and inland capture fisheries, and capture fisheries out of Thai waters by Thai fishing boats. This document, RAP Publication 2008/17, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2008. This section, part 2 of 2, contains the second part of the section on inland fisheries, marine fisheries, a summary and synthesis, references and appendices containing inland fisheries production statistics, inland fisheries statistics, marine capture fisheries calculations and inland capture fisheries calculations. Part 1 is also catalogued in the e-library.
author: D Lymer; S Funge-Smith; P Khemakorn; S Naruepon; S Ubolratana
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Review of fishery information and data collection systems in China
description: This review of the national fishery information and data collection system in China examines: the need for fishery information; data collected; means of data collection; and who collects the data. The document, FAO Fisheries Circular No. 1029, is based on a working paper presented at the second FAO/China Society of Fisheries Workshop on Chinese Fishery and Aquaculture Statistics held in Kunming, Yunnan Province, China in September 2006. It was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2008.
author: Zhijie Guo; Yingliang Xie; Xiangguo Zhang; Yong Wang; Daobo Zhang; Shunji Sugiyama
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Selected basic ASEAN indicators: as of 30 April 2014
description: This leaflet contains a statistical table for the ten country member states of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) including data for each country on land area, population, population density, gross domestic product (GDP), trade (exports and imports) and foreign direct investments. These statistics were published by ASEAN in 2014.

title: Selected key ASEAN macroeconomic indicators: as of 30 April 2014
description: This document contains a table of statistics for the ten country member states of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) including data for each country on growth rate of gross domestic product, inflation rate, exchange rate, unemployment rate, international merchandise trade and change in foreign direct investments. These statistics were published by ASEAN in 2014.

title: South Asia economic focus, Fall 2013: a wake-up call
description: This report presents an update on the economy of South Asia including a summary of the recent economic developments taking place across the region, the overall economic outlook for South Asia, the economic activity affecting South Asia and an economic brief for each country (Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka). A table summarizing the economic output of each of these countries is also included. This report was published by The World Bank in Fall 2013.

title: World Bank South Asia economic update 2010: moving up, looking east
description: This report analyses the economic recovery in South Asia and looks to explain the drivers of economic growth in the region. It goes on to describe the economic policies that have supported this growth and how strengthening intraregional trade links, as well as those with East Asia, have also contributed to this economic growth. Finally, there are profiles of several countries' economies, with tables of key fiscal indicators. This report was published by the World Bank in 2010.
author: The World Bank Group

title: World development report 2016: Digital Dividends
description: The Digital Dividends report focuses on the impact of digital technologies on economic development across the world, as opposed to the technology itself, and raises essential development questions about growth, equity and service delivery to get the most out of the digital revolution. This report includes UIS data and was published by The World Bank in 2016.
author: World Bank

title: Guidelines for risk categorization of food and food establishments applicable to ASEAN countries
description: This document provides guidance on categorizing food businesses on the basis of risk, including determinations of risk category, approaches to categorizing food businesses and frequency of inspection.
author: Dedi Fardiaz
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Comparative study of quantitative and cartographic techniques of banana crop concentration in Raver Tehsil of Jalgaon District (M.S., India)
description: This article examines banana crop concentration in the Jalgaon district of India using quantitative and cartographic methods and compares the two techniques. The article was published in the Journal of Geography and Geology; Vol. 4, No. 2; 2012.
author: Misrilal B Chavan; Shri Kailas S Nile
publisher: Canadian Center of Science and Education

title: Pilot study on the development of the experienced rural tourism in Shijiazhuang of China
description: This article examines rural tourism in the region of Shijiazhuang, China, and provides guidance on further developing rural tourism in this area. The article was published in the Journal of Geography and Geology Vol. 1, No. 1; May 2009.
author: Zhiguo Zhang; Tingting Yang
publisher: Canadian Center of Science and Education

title: English grammar in context: LearningSpace: Open University
description: This advanced module examines the use of grammar as a tool to adapt communications and alter the way in the message is perceived. It covers: reasons for studying grammar; developments in grammatical description; and grammar and contextual variation. The module is expected to take fifteen hours to complete and is provided by the UK Open University as part of its LearningSpace, a collection of over 800 free online courses (as at July 2016).

title: Reestablishment of rural services and revitalization of rural economy
description: This note describes actions taken to stimulate rural economies following natural disasters, and lessons learned. It considers case studies of earthquakes in the Philippines, Turkey, and Pakistan. The note is Working Paper Series No. 5, one of a series of EAP DRM KnowledgeNotes on disaster risk management in East Asia and the Pacific. It was published by The World Bank in 2010. This note was prepared for the Government of China as part of a series of good practice notes on post-disaster recovery following the Wenchuan Earthquake that struck on 12 May 2008.
author: Andrew Goodland

title: 1990s America
description: Learn about the presidency of Bill Clinton and the acceleration of globalization.

title: On the characteristics of housing spatial structure and location selection of residential communities: a case study of Wuhan City
description: This article presents a spatial distribution analysis of residential community development in Wuhan City, China, undertaken using existing statistical data, on-the-spot investigations and GIS. The aim was to provide data which could guide future housing development. The article was published in the Journal of Geography and Geology Vol. 1, No. 1; May 2009.
author: Chengliang Liu; Hong Zhang
publisher: Canadian Center of Science and Education

title: Political economy and urban poverty in the developing countries: lessons learned from Sudan and Malaysia
description: This article discusses the issue of urban poverty in developing countries, using the examples of Sudan and Malaysia. It considers the pattern and causes of urban poverty, and the policies adopted by both countries to eradicate poverty. The article was published in the Journal of Geography and Geology Vol. 4, No. 1; March 2012.
author: Yasin Abdalla Eltayeb Elhadary; Narimah Samat
publisher: Canadian Center of Science and Education

title: Catastrophe insurance policy for China
description: This note examines the need for a catastrophe insurance policy in China and outlines the form that such a policy could take. The note is Working Paper Series No. 17, one of a series of EAP DRM KnowledgeNotes on disaster risk management in East Asia and the Pacific. It was published by The World Bank in 2010. This note was prepared for the Government of China as part of a series of good practice notes on post-disaster recovery following the Wenchuan Earthquake that struck on 12 May 2008.
author: Jun Wang

title: Data against natural disasters: Establishing effective systems for relief, recovery, and reconstruction
description: This book provides case studies for six countries, including Indonesia, examining country-level efforts to establish information management systems to coordinate disaster response. It was published in 2008 by The World Bank and is report no.44983.
author: Samia Amin (Editor); Markus Goldstein (Editor)

title: Disaster risk reduction
description: This note identifies the key elements of an effective disaster management system (risk identification, emergency preparedness, institutional capacity building, risk mitigation, catastrophe risk financing). It examines examples of disaster risk reduction initiatives in three earthquake-affected regions: Los Angeles, California (United States); Marmara, Turkey; and, Gujarat, India; and summarises lessons learned. The note is Working Paper Series No. 13, one of a series of EAP DRM KnowledgeNotes on disaster risk management in East Asia and the Pacific. It was published by The World Bank in 2010. This note was prepared for the Government of China as part of a series of good practice notes on post-disaster recovery following the Wenchuan Earthquake that struck on 12 May 2008.
author: Zoe Trohanis; Arish Dastur; Ting Xu; Dean Cira

title: UNICEF: The state of the world's children: Statistical tables
description: UNICEF's economic and social statistics on the countries and territories of the world, with particular reference to childrens well-being, are published annually in this organisations flagship publication: The state of the worlds children. The report contains the latest updates to the comprehensive statistics provided by UNICEF on child well-being. (Please note that as of June 2017, the data for all countries is in the process of being updated.)

title: Computers and computer systems: LearningSpace: Open University
description: This intermediate module focuses on how computers work. It covers processors, memory, computer systems, representing data, binary code, examples of computers (personal computers, kitchen scales, digital cameras), computer programs and using flowcharts to describe tasks. The module is expected to take twenty hours to complete and is provided by the UK Open University as part of its LearningSpace, a collection of over 800 free online courses (as at July 2016).

title: How to accelerate your Internet: a practical guide to bandwidth management and optimisation using Open Source software, Appendix A: Resources
description: This resource is appendix A of a book providing practical information on how to gain the best possible benefit from an Internet connection. It contains a substantial number of links to further reading on the topics covered in the book, such as security, proxies and caches, tools to fight spamming, policy, firewalls and general resources about the Internet and networking. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.

title: Algebra: Mathematics for computer science facts and formulae
description: A basic introduction to algebra, comprising the formula for solving a quadratic equation, laws of indices, laws of logarithms, the formula for change of base, and some common symbols and notation. The resource forms 1 of 11 mathematics for computer science fact sheets produced by mathcentre.

title: Education
description: This note discusses the use of the education sector to pursue the dual objectives of promoting short-term recovery following natural disasters such as earthquakes, and ensuring better disaster preparedness over the medium term. It uses examples of initiatives undertaken following earthquakes in India, Iran, and Japan. The note is Working Paper Series No. 7, one of a series of EAP DRM KnowledgeNotes on disaster risk management in East Asia and the Pacific. It was published by The World Bank in 2010. This note was prepared for the Government of China as part of a series of good practice notes on post-disaster recovery following the Wenchuan Earthquake that struck on 12 May 2008.
author: Kin Bing Wu

title: Eitaka erizira bantu bakaire
description: Mu bughangwa kamaala,  abantu abakulu baghebwa ekitisa ku lwa magezi no ku ghabula ku nsonga dhobulamu. Mu lufumo luno,  ekibindha kya abavubuka besinhwa okwebuuza ku bakaire era basalawo okubaita okubamala ku kyalo.
author: Charles Eramaga

title: Intergration of GIS using GEOSTAtistical INterpolation Techniques (Kriging) (GEOSTAINT-K) in deterministic models for landslide susceptibility analysis (LSA) at Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia
description: This article presents a landslide susceptibility analysis (LSA) of the area of Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia, using GEOSTAtistical INterpolation Techniques (Kriging) (GEOSTAINT-K) to determine the factor of safety (FOS) and failure probabilities. The article was published in the Journal of Geography and Geology Vol. 4, No. 1; March 2012.
author: Rodeano Roslee; Tajul Anuar Jamaluddin; Mustapa Abd Talip
publisher: Canadian Center of Science and Education

title: Natural disaster risk management in the Philippines: enhancing poverty alleviation through disaster reduction
description: This study examines the impact of natural hazards and disasters in the Philippines. It considers the country's current capacity to reduce and manage disaster risk, and seeks to identify options to more effectively manage that risk. This report, no.33822, was published by The World Bank in 2005.

title: Philippines: Typhoons Ondoy and Pepeng: Post-Disaster Needs Assessment: executive summary
description: This Post-Disaster Needs Assessment (PDNA) aims to provide a detailed assessment of the damage, loss, and economic and social impacts of the Ondoy and Pepeng typhoons in the Philippines and to provide a basis for determining the country's needs for post-disaster recovery and reconstruction. It assesses the impact of the two typhoons on 13 key sectors of the economy, examines cross-sectoral issues and estimates the damage and losses suffered by the private sector. This document, the executive summary of the study, no.64628 v1, was published by The World Bank in 2011. The main report and the sectoral reports are also available in the e-library.

title: Philippines: Typhoons Ondoy and Pepeng: Post-Disaster Needs Assessment: main report
description: This Post-Disaster Needs Assessment (PDNA) aims to provide a detailed assessment of the damage, loss, and economic and social impacts of the Ondoy and Pepeng typhoons in the Philippines and to provide a basis for determining the country's needs for post-disaster recovery and reconstruction. It assesses the impact of the two typhoons on 13 key sectors of the economy, examines cross-sectoral issues and estimates the damage and losses suffered by the private sector. This document, the main report of the study, no.64628 v2, was published by The World Bank in 2011. The executive summary and the sectoral reports are also available in the e-library.

title: Philippines: Typhoons Ondoy and Pepeng: Post-Disaster Needs Assessment: sector reports
description: This Post-Disaster Needs Assessment (PDNA) aims to provide a detailed assessment of the damage, loss, and economic and social impacts of the Ondoy and Pepeng typhoons in the Philippines and to provide a basis for determining the country's needs for post-disaster recovery and reconstruction. It assesses the impact of the two typhoons on 13 key sectors of the economy, examines cross-sectoral issues and estimates the damage and losses suffered by the private sector. This document, no.64628 v3, contains the sectoral reports for the productive sectors (agriculture, enterprise), the social sectors (housing, education, cultural heritage, health) and infrastructure (electricity, water supply and sanitation, flood control, drainage, dam management, transport, telecommunications). It was published by The World Bank in 2011. The executive summary and main report are also available in the e-library.

title: Role of local institutions in reducing vulnerability to recurrent natural disasters and in sustainable livelihoods development: Philippines: part I
description: This case study examines the impact of local institutions in the design and implementation of disaster risk management strategies in one vulnerable area in the Philippines. It discusses: the Philippine hazard and disaster situation; disaster risk management activity; the responses of local institutions to several recent typhoons; and an assessment of the role of local institutions in managing recent disasters. This document, Institutions for Rural Development 8, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 1 of 7, provides the preface, contents list and introduction. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Stephan Baas
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Role of local institutions in reducing vulnerability to recurrent natural disasters and in sustainable livelihoods development: Philippines: part II
description: This case study examines the impact of local institutions in the design and implementation of disaster risk management strategies in one vulnerable area in the Philippines. It discusses: the Philippine hazard and disaster situation; disaster risk management activity; the responses of local institutions to several recent typhoons; and an assessment of the role of local institutions in managing recent disasters. This document, Institutions for Rural Development 8, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 2 of 7, outlines the Philippines situation and provides profiles of the study area and hazards, and the first part of the vulnerability profile. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Stephan Baas
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Role of local institutions in reducing vulnerability to recurrent natural disasters and in sustainable livelihoods development: Philippines: part III
description: This case study examines the impact of local institutions in the design and implementation of disaster risk management strategies in one vulnerable area in the Philippines. It discusses: the Philippine hazard and disaster situation; disaster risk management activity; the responses of local institutions to several recent typhoons; and an assessment of the role of local institutions in managing recent disasters. This document, Institutions for Rural Development 8, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 3 of 7, concludes the vulnerability profile and provides the first part of a discussion of disaster risk management. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Stephan Baas
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title: Answers: Pure mathematics: A-Level course material
description: This resource provides the answers to the exercises included in the 21 chapters dealing with pure mathematics which are contained within the wider collection of A-Level course material provided by the Centre for Innovation in Mathematics Teaching, University of Plymouth. The individual chapters are also catalogued in the e-library.
publisher: Centre for Innovation in Mathematics Teaching (CIMT), University of Plymouth

title: Chi-squared: A-Level course material
description: This resource describes the chi-squared test and its use in determining whether observed data samples are representative of a wider distribution. Descriptions of contingency tables and significance testing are included. Numerous worked examples are presented, with illustrations where applicable. The resource is chapter 11 of 12 dealing with statistics, as part of a wider collection of A-Level course material provided by the Centre for Innovation in Mathematics Teaching, University of Plymouth. Answers to the exercises are also catalogued in the e-library.
publisher: Centre for Innovation in Mathematics Teaching (CIMT), University of Plymouth

title: Continuous probability distributions: A-Level course material
description: This resource provides a discussion of continuous probability distributions. Topics covered include: defining expectation for discrete and continuous distributions, defining mean and variance, and performing calculations. Numerous worked examples are presented, with illustrations where applicable. The resource is chapter 1 of 9 dealing with further concepts in statistics, as part of a wider collection of A-Level course material provided by the Centre for Innovation in Mathematics Teaching, University of Plymouth. Answers to the exercises are also catalogued in the e-library.
publisher: Centre for Innovation in Mathematics Teaching (CIMT), University of Plymouth

title: Role of local institutions in reducing vulnerability to recurrent natural disasters and in sustainable livelihoods development: Philippines: part IV
description: This case study examines the impact of local institutions in the design and implementation of disaster risk management strategies in one vulnerable area in the Philippines. It discusses: the Philippine hazard and disaster situation; disaster risk management activity; the responses of local institutions to several recent typhoons; and an assessment of the role of local institutions in managing recent disasters. This document, Institutions for Rural Development 8, was published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) in 2006. This section, part 4 of 7, continues the discussion of disaster risk management. Other sections of this publication are also catalogued in the e-library.
author: Stephan Baas
publisher: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

This section, part 5 of 7, concludes the discussion of disaster risk management, provides a risk profile and commences a discussion of the response of local institutions to recent hazards.
